We really enjoyed the cheap and very tasty Vietnamese food restaurants around (try Pagolac and Mangosteen both on Larkin) Free breakfast was not amazing by any means, standard fare, bake goods, bagels and apples & Oranges. Coffee was decent. All in all a great experience and very central location, 4 blocks to the BART and walking distance to everything (if you like to walk).

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing CA feeling”
Reviews.Author: MissCA_in_NYC
Reviews.Content: Phoenix is great. The neighborhood is NOT dangerous--it has a 'downtown' feel and if you are staying in the front section there is a little street noise, but there are no projects here, which in my opinion are what make SF neighborhoods dangerous. If you have any sense of culinary curiosity, you will appreciate the many Vietnamese, Thai, Indonesian and even a few Japanese restaurants around here. Staff was nice, rooms are spacious, clean, cute, fun, pool is heated, balconies are awesome! But there is a certain je ne sais quoi, a certain relaxing vibe here that is the heart of what makes the Phoenix great. I can't wait to stay again, hopefully in spring or summer. My only complaint was that when i was there, admittedly during freakishly cold weather, the room heater wasn't quite powerful enough to warm the whole room and bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “little oasis”
Reviews.Author: sandyness
Reviews.Content: Please don't worry about this location...There are people asking for money on the street but they are totally harmless!. Great value, particularly if you have a car, as parking is free. The rooms are clean and comfortable. We had 4 adults staying in one room with 2 beds. The room is plenty big enough for 4 but the beds a little small, at least by american standards, but really comfortable. Very cool vibe, an oasis in the middle of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Fun place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: griffinn
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at this hotel recently. I have lived in SF for years and wanted to stay but since I moved away I was able to. This hotel is very funky and fun. The staff are very cool, nice and knowledgeable. The price is about average for SF and the renovated rooms are very comfortable. This is especially a good place for people into live music (many bands stay here) and want a true San Francisco experience. It's close to all the things most people want and even have a map to the best live music venues. Just ask the staff for any help and they will oblige. If you are looking for a fancy, overpriced hotel, this is not the place for you. It is very comfortable, the continental breakfast is good, people seemed to be enjoying the heated pool...it was 48 degrees outside so we passed on that but there were people still partaking. I've heard that the restaurant and nightclub is very good altho we had just danced our "*&^es" off at the Warfield so we were quite beat. All I can say if you want a fun experience, give the Phoenix Hotel a try...it is a better choice for those young or young at heart!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: Bigbluewoman
Reviews.Content: The Phoenix Hotel is Great and the Staff are very friendly and helpful. The rooms are very comfortable and the courtyard is ideal for hanging out with friends and just relaxing. I was a bit worried about the comments on the surrounding neighborhood because I was bringing teenagers along but we walked all around the surrounding neighborhood and used public transportation all around the city without any problems even at night. We talked to a bunch of the street people in the area and never once did we feel threatened. We walked to and from the Warfield on Market St for a concert at night and it was not an issue. The hotel is in an ideal location for all public transportation including BART and most buses and we went all over the city from the hotel. We did catch a cab a couple times and the front office called one for us and they were at the door in 2 mins very helpful. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Phoenix Hotel rocked!”
Reviews.Author: danted23
Reviews.Content: The hotel is close to the Civic Center BART stop so it's quite easy to get to. Upon our arrival we quickly checked in and had dinner at The Bambuddha Lounge. The food/service was great. Very affordable too. Afterwards we stepped in to the Lounge area where a DJ was spinning tunes. Our room was very clean and tidy. Every morning there was a continental breakfast that was very tasty. The front desk was very helpful and would have a cab out front for us within 5 minutes when we needed one. Kudos to everyone at the front desk!

Reviews.Title: “Hip & Happy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FozzieForever
Reviews.Content: I had my reservations about staying in a "rock" hotel. They didn't last long. The central courtyard was an ideal place to hang out as we were traveling with friends. I loved all the art features and the ambient night lighting. The local area is certainly "colourful" and I was more comfortable taking taxis at night. The staff were extremely helpful and friendly. Breakfast at first glance looks average. But when I sat and enjoyed mine by the pool - the coffee was excellent, and there was a regularly replenished selection of great pastries. My one request/ suggestion would be a greater selections of juices. All in all - I would go back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “The Phoenix: Comfortable Safe Haven”
Reviews.Author: cre8tive921
Reviews.Content: I must say the hotel was different from what I was used to but was very suitable for a one night stay. Clean and very friendly staff. The surrounding area of the hotel is horrible, but that is not a refelction of them. The deserve a much better location. They have bright colors and a rock star theme. In my opinon its good for a brief stay. Just BEWARE OF THE NEIGHBORHOOD, but if you cant find something else this location is a safe haven for you in the midst of the jungle.

Reviews.Title: “Great, unique hotel.”
Reviews.Author: mcisaacpr
Reviews.Content: The Phoenix is located in the Tenderloin/Little Saigon area of San Francisco, which can be a little, uh, colorful, to say the least. That's not to say it's a threatening neighborhood; it's not. It's a bit transitional, though. But the Phoenix itself is a great place. Very hip and very friendly. The rooms are appointed in a mid-century modern style, and they're spacious. The staff is professional and very outgoing. The place is very clean and remarkably quiet, given it's located in the heart of the city. I get to San Francisco often and plan to stay there again soon, and I wouldn't hesitate to recommend it to anyone but the most conservative traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Phoenix!”
Reviews.Author: dcsham
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were in San Francisco to see an AC/DC tribute band playing at Slim's nightclub. On Slim's website, there is a link recommending the Phoenix Hotel, so after checking out the hotel online and liking what we saw, we decided to book a room for a one night stay. The hotel is a unique combination of '50s retro with Asian influences. All of the rooms face an interior courtyard that features a nice pool and sitting area where you can relax and have a cocktail from the Bambuddha Lounge which shares the property. Our room had bright colors, a ceiling fan with wide, bamboo blades, and magazines dedicated to the local music scene in San Francisco. The Phoenix is within walking distance or a short taxi ride to many famous music venues, including Slim's, The Great American Music Hall, and the Warfield Theatre on Market Street. The neighborhood is edgy and unique, but not in the least threatening or intimidating. The friendly staff will direct you to the best of the city's music venues and restaurants, and there is no better city in the world to eat and enjoy a great show! My wife and I have been rock and roll fans since we were in high school in the '70s, and the Phoenix Hotel and the AC/DC music made us feel like we were 18 again. We had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED THE PHOENIX”
Reviews.Author: napacarrie
Reviews.Content: From the moment we checked in to the moment we checked out we were treated so wonderful. The office staff was extremely efficient and accomidating. Our rooms were very clean and comfortable. The brunch in the morning was more than adequite. The pool was very nice and warm. I would recommend the Phoenix to anyone looking for a great place to stay. What a find!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great staff”
Reviews.Author: RickHawaii
Reviews.Content: stayed at the Phoenix hotel for a work meeting during a week that , due to a dentist convention and the Folsom Street fair weekend, all other hotels were booked, I initially only had the room for 3 days to the week end and was going to have to move to another hotel for the week end, I liked the hotel so much that I asked to extend there and the staff were great and let me know when there was a cancellation so I could stay, staff were very nice and accomodating, knew all about the area and san francisco in general, this is not the hotel for the faint hearted, that is , it is in the Tenderloin, a very dicey neighborhood with lots of street people, but it was a very cool place, 50s style, two story small motel with funky eclectic art, a trendy (too trendy ) bar that was filled with fashionable 20 somethings, the courtyard and pool were great, the breafast was just bagels and muffins but there was great coffee, tea and oj. there is wifi access, FREE parking (must be last place in San fran with that), I had two different rooms, one was great and had a separate sitting area, the other had a balcony but was louder, due to its location. good price and nice people, there was a wedding with a bunch of middle class people from the midwest who were not sure how to take the mixture of types of people (european tourists, gay couples, wanna be rock and rollers) but everyone tolerated each other and a good time was had by all

Reviews.Title: “A 'find' in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: journeysseattle
Reviews.Content: Located on the edge of the tenderloin, the Phoenix is literally an oasis with a heated pool. The staff is more than friendly and the property has been upgraded and is perfectly located for walking to the Civic Center, the Asian Art Museum, the Opera and the Symphony. The neighborhood is a bit seedy but filled with Asian restaurants and the street people can be avoided by walking a block or two away. The crowd from the lounge spills into the courtyard, but the staff is very good about cutting off the noise at 10 PM on weekdays. If you are staying over a weekend, it gets a bit rowdy around the pool until cutoff time which is later. Join the 'Joy of Life Club' (just google it) before booking a room for some extra treats and check out their other properties,,, great little hotel chain!

Reviews.Title: “the best place to stay in san fran”
Reviews.Author: karennn
Reviews.Content: what a truely unique hotel! forget all the comments about its bad location. there are bums and street people everywhere in san francisco, that is just part of the city. i found where the phoenix was, in location to everything else...PERFECT. 10 walking blocks from union square and about 3 from the bus routes which can take you pretty much anywhere. the staff was extremely helpful. upon arrival they gave us and map and told us how to get around. we were also able to check in 4 hours early. ive heard it gets loud during the week because of the bambudda lounge, but we stayed on sunday and it was beyond quiet. the room was big, clean, very open, and had great reading material. went swimming at night and the pool looked beautiful. the lounging areas, statues, and art in the courtyard all add to the amazing ambiance of the phoenix. free parking doesnt hurt either!

Reviews.Title: “Unique, Funky, and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: JeremyJM33
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at The Phoenix after two weeks of traveling the coast of CA. Was recommended from my cuz and the price seemed very fair for SF. The courtyard really sets the mood for your stay. With different sculpters, meditation huts, and the heated number 9 pool. Which I reccomend swimming in after the sun has set. The room provided just what we needed from a convience and comfort standpoint. The room also had it's Phoenix touch, with colorful and stimulating decore. It was the pefect way to end our trip and I look forward to my next trip to SF and another stay at The Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price”
Reviews.Author: ghostmusic
Reviews.Content: If you've never been to San Francisco and you want opulence, you shouldn't stay at The Phoenix. The Tenderloin is one of the least savory neighborhoods in the city and the hotel itself is geared more towards mildly successful rock musicians, or people who like to consider themselves as such, or people who like to consort with the above. However! If you're looking for an offbeat, cheap, fun, clean hotel perfectly located for easy access to most of what SF has to offer (or at least to transportation that affords easy access), with fantastic service and great food options nearby, The Phoenix is your place. You won't find another hotel in San Francisco quite like it. A free parking space comes with the room, but you probably won't need your own transportation once you're here because the subway and bus are within a couple of blocks, and much of the action is walkable. The hotel itself has a lot of character with a charming courtyard and pool, palm trees, and the occasional quirky Polynesian touch. Rock 'n' Roll is there to stay, too, with music recommendations in the lobby and, when I was there, a rock band tour bus-looking vehicle in the parking lot and a Smashing Pumpkins van. Absolutely the only drawback of the hotel is that it is in the Tenderloin, which ceases to be as much of an issue once you've acclimated to the many "charms" of San Francisco. Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Laid back Phoenix Hotel worth checking out”
Reviews.Author: irondi
Reviews.Content: Stayed twice at the Phoenix Hotel - once with my teen son, and once with my daughter. Will definitely stay there again. Felt welcomed, comfortable. Breakfast by the outdoor poor was relaxing; wonderful place to hang out, read the paper, etc. Staff attentive, friendly, helpful. Room was very clean, non-pretentious. Loved the greeting card, wine, chocolates. On-site parking an added bonus. Neighborhood is a bit sketchy, but not a deterrent. Easy to get around the city from here.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect fit for me”
Reviews.Author: J1O
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Phoenix on two trips, been very happy both times, and will stay there again the next time San Francisco calls. Yes, it isn't for everyone, but I think it's pretty easy to figure out which camp you fall into. I found the location central and convenient to mass transit, the room comfortable, and the slightly-edgy retro atmosphere charming, attractive and pleasantly unstuffy. The hipster folks at the front desk were friendly and welcoming. If the noise from the bar (which I'll admit I didn't particularly care for) is an issue for you, request a room at the back of the courtyard, sheltered a bit behind trees and gardens from the scene out front.

Reviews.Title: “All happening at The Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: nineylou
Reviews.Content: Don' t be put off by the location of The Phoenix. Being in the heart of the Tenderloin District for me only added to it's appeal & character. We stayed here on two separate ocassions during our trip to the USA & both times were able to check in early. Terrific when arriving after long travel days.The staff were helpful & booked tours, taxis etc on request. They even recommend a terrific hairdresser. (Thanks Pam !!) The rooms are clean & comfortable with plenty of room. Noise levels can be high depending on what type of function is on at the Bambudda Bar. Definitely not for light sleepers, those who don't like to party or watch other people having a good time. Would recommend the Phoenix if you want a to meet a broad range of fellow travellers & experience another side of San Francisco. Would go back in a flash.

Reviews.Title: “I like the Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: milesgehm
Reviews.Content: I started staying at the Phoenix about 3 years ago. I go up to SF several times a year to see bands play. I have always been happy with my room, the staff, and my stay in general. I've stayed there about 10 times. There is nothing fancy or luxurious about it, but everything is clean. The staff are friendly and knowledgeable. Lots of spots are within walking distance, and everything no more than a $7 taxi ride away. I am a sound sleeper and the noise never bothers me. The neighborhood is commercial/retail and it is a big city. You see lots of normal people and plenty of weird street people. I've walked back to the hotel from clubs at 1 AM and never had any problems. In the morning, the continental breakfast is good, and eating it out by the pool is cool. For lunch, there are a million options in the neighborhood. In the evening, the Bambuddha lounge (physically part of the hotel) is a very good restaurant and the bar has a happening happy hour with good stiff drinks for a reasonable price. You see guests dressed up in suits going out to dinner, and guests dressed up in leather, ripped denim, and safety pins going out to slam dance. It is a diverse place! My wife went up by herself in May to see the Dali Lama at the Civic Auditorium. She stayed 2 nights and loved it! She was mad I hadn't told her how cool it was. She insisted we stay there on our next trip to San Francisco together. That was at the end of June for 3 nights and we really enjoyed it. Photos are here flickr.com/photos/milesgehm/tags/phoenixhotel/

Reviews.Title: “First stay in SF”
Reviews.Author: marcbrewster
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to San Francisco. Loved the city and loved this hotel. Yes the Tenderloin is a crap neighbourhood but I have been in worse. The Phoenix is a little oasis, literally with the pool and pagoda's etc, and I found it to be an excellent recommendation from a friend. The staff were very friendly and knowledgeable about the area and places to hang out. The room was funky and fairly stylishly decorated. Place had a nice atmosphere. Had a quick meal and a drink in the bar (bambudha lounge?) which was excellent. All in all when I go back to SF I will be staying here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Horrible!”
Reviews.Author: happyguyfortravel
Reviews.Content: I'm an extremely forgiving and liberal person and really enjoyed the off-beat feel of the hotel itself. And the front-desk people were nice. But the entire experience was absolutely ruined by the incredibly loud pounding music from the BamBuddha Lounge. The music and loud shouting by drunken patrons of the lounge went on until after one o'clock in the morning. I complained to the front desk and was told that this was common. They apologized but couldn't do anything about it. I might add that the street noise--the hotel is in a very rough part of town--adds to the overall chaos. Stay away from this place!

Reviews.Title: “Was dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: Wattamolla
Reviews.Content: I had accepted that the area we were going to be staying in was rough and that it would be noisy and I was willing to accept all that as it has a great restaurant and bar on site. However you could never get into Bambuddah lounge as they constantly had it closed for private parties and then just closed over the 5 night. There are way better places to stay if you are going to do some touristy sites were you can possibly have a quiet enough space for an afternoon nap at the very least before heading out as morning, noon and night that place is hard to get some uninterrupted sleep.

Reviews.Title: “What a Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: Xander101
Reviews.Content: A bunch of friends chose to stay at the Civic Center Inn up the street, but after checking out the Phoenix's website, I knew this is where I wanted to be. And I was not mistaken! The room was clean, bright, and a bit on the eccentric side...which was a good thing for me! The staff was friendly and incredibly helpful. I remember reading a review warning about noise from the club, but I didn't have a problem with it at all. The courtyard has its own flavor and, in a way, looked out of place from anything you'd think you'd see in San Francisco. But that's what made this place so great! My friends who visited me from the Civic Center Inn were jealous. For not much more money, I got a place that would make my trip far more memorable, a place that only added to my experience. Especially when compared to their bland choice. I plan on going back soon and trying out the lounge and the pool. But I guarantee you, I will be back to the Phoenix every time I go to the City!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in an OK location”
Reviews.Author: izbraun
Reviews.Content: If youâ€™re into progressively decorated hotels with a hip feel to them then youâ€™ll love this place. It has an awesome courtyard area with a pool and mini pagodas to sit in. We were there on a rare San Francisco warm and sunny spring weekend so we enjoyed the pool which added to the appeal of the place. The staff was really nice and were very accommodating with some special needs we had. The price was average for this town; the Civic hotel is right around the corner and has cheaper rooms but itâ€™s a typical 2 star place. If you just need a place to sleep and act as a staging place to explore the city then stay at the Civic, but if the hotel stay is part of the adventure of your trip then stay at the Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “Phoenix Hotel Rocks”
Reviews.Author: musiclovepeace
Reviews.Content: Hello folks! The Phoenix Hotel is truely great. Its my home away from home.. I stay there 6-10 times a year when Im up to the City to see shows/concerts. Yeah, its a bit loud at times.. it is a rock'n'roll hotel after all! Go there knowing that it most likely will be a bit loud late. Just go get yourself a fabulous Mojito from the restaurant across the courtyard, grab one of the interesting magazines that are in your room, go out by the pool and chill for a bit. Im not sure how to say this... but, umm.. theres always some creative artist types around.. this place is just cool. The rooms are newly renovated and very comfortable. Joint their Joy Of Life rewards club.. its free and you'll get a free bottle of wine in your room apon arrival. And I simply cannot say enough about the staff.. Super sweet and helpfull with anything you might need.. Diana is a pure sweetheat and always remembers me when I walk to the check in counter. Oh, and the free breakfast is very good. Pastry, bagles, juice.. and GOOD coffee (none of that brown water junk some hotels serve!).. free newspapers, beautiful courtyard. As you can see I love this hotel and can recommend it.. I wont stay anywhere else when I go to SF. ~give me the beat boy and free my soul, wanna get lost in that rock and roll and drift away~

Reviews.Title: “horrible experience”
Reviews.Author: WendyNyc
Reviews.Content: i thought this would be an interesting hotel, the photographs all looked very cool and the price was definately on target. When we arrived the check in was quick and friendly, we even hung out with Rachel at the front desk one night. That was the only good night we had. The following nights were doors slamming, people drunk out of their minds yelling over to their friends from across the compound from 1am until about 4am, by our last night we called to complain 3 times b/c a man was sitting outside of his room with the door open and music blasting. The night staff went to ask him to turn it down, and we heard his conversation. He was actually apologizing to the guy blaring his music and pointed out our room and said "yeah, it's them again...they're complaining". So, there was no incentive for anyone to keep quiet for the sake of the other guests. My only resort was to lie in bed wide awake, until 5am, when my taxi was coming to take me to the airport. And he was still out there, drunk and blaring music. If you're into staying up all night , night after night- by all means, stay at the Phoenix. If you actually want to sleep, avoid at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis in the big City!”
Reviews.Author: Shannontucker
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel! It was charming and hip. The staff was very friendly. The restaurant next door was very good asian fusion cuisine. We liked that we could walk through the hotel courtyard and have a really great meal. I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great bargain”
Reviews.Author: wmforweb
Reviews.Content: Great price (about $110) for a clean, funky place right in downtown SF. Staff was very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant !”
Reviews.Author: jjcopenhagen
Reviews.Content: It was, as always, an absolutely pleasure to stay at the Phoenix. Friendly staff, easy check-in, and great rooms, especially compared to the price. Can't wait to come back! Jonas Jacobsen, Copenhagen, Denmark

Reviews.Title: “Best Deal in S.F.”
Reviews.Author: NewlyCentered
Reviews.Content: The Phoenix is very clean and extremely friendly. The atmosphere is tropical with a great pool and a good restaurant/lounge. It will be my place to stay from now on in San Francisco

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for the girls!”
Reviews.Author: LCattheBeach
Reviews.Content: One of friends found this hotel for the two San Fran nights that kicked off our girls trip. The property itself was great. Lots of interesting art and sculptures and warm and funky decorated rooms - kind of in a tiki style. The room itself just had a really colorful, fun vibe. The bedding was awesome - comfy (a priority for me), the bathrooms were clean and there was lots of space. We'd had a chance to walk a lot around the surrounding neighborhood, and I have to say I did not feel unsafe but there are more prosperous parts of town. That said, the two other gals took a run after dark and were fine. Breakfast was super, lots of choices, coffee, juice, bagels, fruit, toast, pop tarts, croissants, etc. The only thing we were unaware of was the $20 per night charge to have our 3rd person in the room. So if there are more than 2 of you, take that into account if price is a priority. One perk if you're staying in this hotel - you get free admission to the buddha lounge, adjacent to the Phoenix check in. It's a fun spot with really great music, actually. Didn't make it there the first night but stopped there the 2nd before bed and people were having a blast.

Reviews.Title: “Old SF feel + tiki lounge style & hip elegance”
Reviews.Author: hcsminx
Reviews.Content: I loved my stay at the Phoenix hotel. A friend of mine who lives in SF recommended the hotel to me. She mentioned it may not be a good place to stay on my business trip, however, I found it to be very accommodating and quiet. The BART station is just 5 blocks from the hotel - a nice brisk walk away. The Bambudda Lounge has excellent food (the best edamame ever) and provides a nice happy hour. The outside patio is very romantic- it has cushion seats, a warm fireplace and outdoor speakers playing soft tropical tunes. The pool is warm and clean. The teak lounge chairs that surround the pool area were a great place to enjoy the SF sunshine as well as the complimentary magazines that were in my room- Paper, 7x7, and one other. The staff was polite and attentive- they provided wakeup calls and recommended restaurants w/in the area. The room was bright, spacious and very clean. I was very pleased with my stay at the Phoenix and can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: dboat
Reviews.Content: This is our third stay at the Phoenix. It has such a great atmosphere. The rooms are always clean, and a nice size. The grounds are tropical and the rooms feel like you are on a tropical vacation with their bamboo, and ceiling fans. Since we are members of the Joy of Life Club (a free benefit) we get some freebies when we arrive including a drink and chocolate to start our stay. The free continental breakfast and a heated pool are great extras. No charge for parking is unheard of in San Francisco. And their room rates are unbeliveable. The location, right on the edge of the Tenderloine district, might scare off some but don't let it or you'll be missing out on a great place to stay. There is a restaurant on site, easy food like KFC and pizza just blocks away, or great restaurants just a couple miles away. The wharf is only three miles. And the staff is always wonderful. Very helpful, full of information, and always willing to give any assistance they can. We won't stay anyplace else anymore when we are visiting the city.

Reviews.Title: “Bohemian Rhapsody in the City”
Reviews.Author: LunaSea123
Reviews.Content: This was my fourth stay here and I feel like this hotel is an old friend. The grounds are terrific- a tiny tropical-artsy oasis on the edge of the tenderloin. The staff is friendly and helpful, and this attidtude even seems to rub off on interactions with the other guests. The breakfast buffet is tasty and fresh, with quality coffee and teas, not the usual motel fare at all. The rooms are attractively decorated, not elegant, but creative and comfy, and the price is right- especially when you take the free parking into account.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the environment”
Reviews.Author: drrink
Reviews.Content: Great atmosphere. The friendly environment that this place creates is unbeatable. The Bambudda lounge is awesome. The location is near the Tenderloin district, but if you are street smart you will be fine outside the hotel. The only reason I gave 4 stars instead of 5 is because my room needed some renovations. But I was told that the hotel would be renovating pretty soon. I would definitely stay there again once renovations are done.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. Will stay again next time...definitely!”
Reviews.Author: karbon69
Reviews.Content: I travel to San Francisco a lot and have had more than my share of less-than-desirable hotel stays there. But the Phoenix - I was very impressed. The courtyard/swimming pool area is beautiful and very relaxing. The room was spacious, clean and nicely designed. The shower was awesome. All the staff were extremely friendly and helpful. The bed was comfy. I like the location - central to everything - on the edge of the Tenderloin but not in the worst part of it. There are many decent restaurants, bars and clubs within walking distance. The guests were, as a whole, quite young and hip. Because of the courtyard you don't get the street noise that you do in many other hotels in San Francisco. They let me check in quite early, which was very nice after a long, cramped, early morning flight from Chicago. My only minor complaints were that the room had only a small heater which didn't seem to work 100%, so I was a bit chilly for a while, and my room didn't come equipped with a frig, which would have come in handy. Also the only chairs in the room were made of bamboo and weren't very comfortable. But, I can't say enough good things about how awesome the courtyard area is. I'd like to go back when it's warm enough to swim. I absolutely loved The Phoenix, and will definitely stay there when I visit next time.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely retro motel, clean and fun, good location.”
Reviews.Author: kelkel45
Reviews.Content: Prior to staying at the Pheonix in August 2005, I read reviews on this site that warned of nighttime noise and other problems. While the place is famed as a rock-n-roll hotel (and the earnestness of the staff's rocker "look" is a little funny/silly), we didn't find it too loud at all. However, it's not the kind of place you stay if you're in town for early business meetings. We stayed up half the night entertaining friends in our room, but we did not receive any complaints from our neighbors, nor were we at any time disturbed by them. I remember from years ago that the hotel bar here was very fashionable, cool, and fun, but this no longer seems to be the case - it was pretty much a dud, very dark, deserted, and too loud. But the pool and pool area were lovely, the staff were friendly, and the room - while certainly not luxe - was clean and comfortable. It could have been a little bigger, though, seeing as how we had a king-size bed. See the attached, very blurry picture for an idea of how pretty the courtyard looks at night. The Tenderloin is wacky, for sure - NOT the cleanest or calmest of urban areas, but that, to me, is part of the experience. My boyfriend and I walked to and from the hotel after dark, but you may want to avoid doing this if homeless people cause you alarm. I would highly recommend the Pheonix for people travelling for fun with friends or partners.

HotelInfo.Name: Phoenix Hotel, a Joie de Vivre hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 601 Eddy Street, San Francisco, CA 94109
